Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: llhsgp
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I have stayed there for 4 nights. The price of the hotel is certainly among the cheapest but the experience was terrible. Hence, if you are not that on budget, please choose some other hotel. Seriously!! Let me elaborate that: 1. The TV is those antique bulky kind and I often need to give it a hit to make the screen display images if not it will just stay black and play sound only, 2. The windows were sealed so we cannot open them and the air ventilation in the toilet is bad. So, if someone passes gas or takes a number one, then we have to open the room to ventilate the air. 3. The hotel is very stingy. There is some kind of chemical liquid in a container in the toilet that is for handwash, bodywash as well as hairwash. I really wonder what that is! Anyway, It is terrible. so if you are planning to stay there, please bring your toiletries. 4. Do not be fooled by the free internet access. it is only free for one person per room. how hilarious! they will give you a set of username and password that can be only used by one person for real. 5. The aircon is pretty old and it does not sync with the remote control well so the temperature always changes for some reason. I have caught a flu after a stay. so be careful if you are staying there. I hope this is useful.

Reviews.Title: “I'will stay another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zafrul_Hasan
Reviews.Content: I was there in 2007 on my way back from China. The room was very very less spacious. You have to enter the room and lay down or sit down on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine”
Reviews.Author: MissVxxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights last year for a quick trip. The room was very small and also the bed. The location was a bit far from the station (or maybe I lost my track). Around the area is clean like the other areas of the city. Restaurants and pubs nearby to enjoy the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “How typically Singaporean!”
Reviews.Author: SaltyBodiceRipper
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were down at Singapore last month when he got back from Middle East to drop his sister at Tempenis (did I spell it right?) and we didn't want to stay with them so we decided to stay in a cheap hotel where we parked our car. We checked a few hotels around and this was the cheapest we found in the area. I think we paid around SGD 100 for a standard room. We were soo lucky we got a lovely room at the top most floor of the hotel. Next time you go to this branch of hotel 81, ask for room 501. You can virtually climb on the root and watch the night skyline from there. YES! ROOFTOP! One thing though the lift only stops at 3rd floor so you got to lug your luggage all the way to 5th floor. When we stayed there, they had this rack of dirty towels and linen lying around all over the stairs to the 5th floor. We had to thread over it to get to our room. There's this small swing right outside our room and the nice balmy weather made it nice for us to drink and enjoy the skyline at night. The was one problem tho, the air cond was leaking and there was a towel placed underneath it to collect the puddling water. Typically Singaporean, the loo had combs and toothbrush. There was a bathtub too, and the water force was relatively good. The TV was too small tho..well all in all, I'd say this is a good place to stay at night, and 501 is so peaceful and quiet at night..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel away from the center”
Reviews.Author: Rattaman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Chinatown, on the street with night clubs and nightlife. There are groups of ladies spending time at front of some night clubs. However, the area is safe and silent. The hotel is about 2km from the MRT and 100 meters from the bus stop. The rooms are small, but clean and modern. Hotel is user-friendly. Price is adequate to the quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints for a 1 night stopover”
Reviews.Author: Cosmopolitaniel
Reviews.Content: Thin doors and there was something going in front of our door until I fell asleep and from when I woke up. Someone cleaning the next room all the time (why?), leaving the door open so I can hear what they are cleaning, e.g. toilet flushing.  Slamming doors, people coming and going, quite active. The room itself was adequate though. Cable TV with DVD. Small toilet room with toilet, sink and shower head in the same space. Smokey smell.    Kind staff. Let us leave the backpacks in the lobby for an hour after check-out.   Restaurant corner Joo Chiat and East Coast. Fried Mee Suah, Katong Laksa. 4SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but in the red light ditrict”
Reviews.Author: EKSAYERS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night and choose it on price and proximity to the airport. Although the hotel is in the Red Light Area it is close to some excellent eating places. I would not recommend the hotel for a woman travelling alone. My partner had left the key at reception when we went out for dinner after only been in the room for 1 hour. We are asked if we were coming back. This indicates what sort of clientele it can attract!

Reviews.Title: “Why spend a fortune when you can stay here?”
Reviews.Author: kyoozoocanada
Reviews.Content: OK, it's not The Ritz, but dollar for dollar, it's a lot better than The Ritz in my wife's and my opinion. The neighborhood is interesting, near the Malay hub of Singapore, and it's near a food centre that has a stall which makes the best ROJAK in Singapore. Our room was clean and quiet, overall. The bed was comfortable, the TV good, and the bathroom clean and totally functional. The staff were friendly, and the hotel itself was very clean. The price was definitely right. Our room was SMALL, but that didn't bother us one bit. Just to let you all know.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 - Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 238 Joo Chiat Road, Singapore 427495, Singapore
